intro: Cucumis angolensis, commonly known as the Angola cucumber, is a flowering plant species native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes other cucurbits like cucumbers and melons. The plant produces small, green, edible fruits that are typically harvested when immature. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with five petals. Cucumis angolensis is often grown for its culinary uses and has adapted to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments.
